Stress Dispersion for Given Euler Pole Coordinates

euler_stress_dispersion.Rd

Stress Dispersion for Given Euler Pole Coordinates

Usage

euler_stress_dispersion(x, grid, prd, prob = 0.75)

Arguments

x

data.frame containing the coordinates of the point(s) (lat, lon), the direction of \(\sigma_{Hmax}\) azi and its standard deviation unc (optional)

grid

grid given as sfc object

prd

numeric. The theoretical orientation of \(\sigma_{Hmax}\) in PoR coordinates

prob

Upper quantile threshold for circular dispersion to remove outliers. Default is 0.75

Value

SpatRaster

Examples

data("san_andreas", package = "tectonicr")
euler_stress_dispersion(san_andreas, grid = latlon_grid(gridsize = 10), prd = 135)
#> class       : SpatRaster 
#> size        : 9, 36, 1  (nrow, ncol, nlyr)
#> resolution  : 10, 10  (x, y)
#> extent      : -180, 180, 0, 90  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax)
#> coord. ref. : lon/lat WGS 84 (EPSG:4326) 
#> source(s)   : memory
#> name        : dispersion 
#> min value   :  0.3595780 
#> max value   :  0.9946692
